page.title: 05Industry and Employmant
page.content: East Wemyss has had a connection with the production of cloth for centuries. The manufacture of linen was both the most important industry and the largest employer of men and women until the development of the coal mining industry in the late 1800s. From 1750 linen manufacture became the main industry of East Wemyss and was carried out mostly in the home with hand operated looms. The Johnston brothers established their linen manufacturing business in East Wemyss in 1828. The factory is still in operation today employing 160 people. Linen is still the principle fibre, although in some of the fabrics linen is blended with newer man-made fibres to produce the hard wearing materials the company now specialises in. The factory is now owned by a Dundee firm and called Wemyss Weavecraft.
